intro: Hetaeria alta, commonly known as the highland orchid, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale pink or white. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Hetaeria alta is considered a rare and endangered species.
